intro: Lactucosonchus beltraniae, commonly known as the Beltrania milkweed, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Beltrania. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a cluster of small flowers. The plant produces milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Lactucosonchus. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are typically yellow or white. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
